document_data.name: White-Furred Snake
document_data.mainbody: '''White-furred snakes''', also known as '''snow serpents''', were a species of [[Constrictor snake|constrictor]] [[snake]] native to cold regions.
document_data.Description: As their name suggested, these snakes were covered in white fur. Their hairs were barbed so as to gain better traction on snow and ice. They grew to be up to {{SI|100|feet|long=yes}} long, and were warm-blooded.
document_data.Behavior: White-furred snakes would lie in wait for prey along snowy mountain paths. They attacked with a powerful bite, but the danger lay in their ability to constrict and crush their prey.

Ecology.Homelands:
They were endemic to the [[Bloodstone Lands]] of [[Damara]] and [[Vaasa]].

White-furred snakes could also be found on the [[planet|world]] of [[Nehwon]],
Ecology.Uses: Their fur could be used for a wide range of unusual functions.
